story.text: (Adds share movement, analyst comment, NEW YORK to dateline)NEW YORK Jan 3 (Reuters) - NetBank Inc. NTBK.O said on Wednesday it sold 6.5 million shares privately for $3.90 each, well below their closing price on Friday, in a move that pulled the company's public shares as much as 12.3 percent lower. The issuance is generating about $23.7 million of funds for NetBank, which has not posted a profit since the fourth quarter of 2005. The online bank and mortgage lender plans to use the proceeds for regular business activities. NetBank is struggling to grow amid a difficult interest rate environment for banks. The short-term rates at which banks borrow are very close to the long-term rates at which they lend, which shrinks margins. NetBank's growth may also be limited by the fact that it mainly works with consumers online, said Peyton Green, an analyst at FTN Midwest Securities in Nashville. Most major U.S. banks offer online banking, but most are also boosting their branch networks to serve customers who want to work with humans. Younger consumers are more comfortable with Internet banking, but older customers, who tend to have more assets, often prefer banking at branches, "There's a place for Internet banking, but the question is, how big can an Internet-only bank be?" Green said. NetBank's shares were down 24 cents at $4.40 in morning trading on the Nasdaq stock exchange, after falling to as low as $4.07. NetBank's privately placed shares are not yet registered and cannot be traded, which is why they are worth less than the company's public shares, analysts said.
story.title: update 1 - netbank sells stock privately , public shares drop
